summary: The module coordinates the full spectrum of maternal health services for pregnant women, from routine antenatal visit scheduling and focused care to emergency management of complications such as post‑abortion issues, ectopic pregnancy, and severe hypertension. It handles inpatient admissions, follow‑up testing, and delivers a wide range of preventive and therapeutic interventions—including nutritional supplementation, infection screening, blood transfusion, and medication administration—based on gestational age and clinical eligibility.
business_intent: To provide a comprehensive framework that simulates or manages the delivery, timing, and eligibility of maternal health interventions within a health system, ensuring that pregnant women receive appropriate routine care, emergency treatment, and follow‑up services to improve pregnancy outcomes.
